xxl.core.xml.relational.sax
Class XMLMetaDataCursor

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor
      xxl.core.xml.relational.sax.XMLMetaDataCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, Cursor, MetaDataCursor, MetaDataProvider
public class XMLMetaDataCursor
extends AbstractCursor
implements MetaDataCursor

An implementation of the java.sql.ResultSet interface.

This class uses a sax parser to parse a document. The user can define the location where the data/metadata is placed. A DataStepByStepHandler is used in combination with a DecoratorXPathHandler. The constructor creates a new thread in which the parser starts parsing the document.The DataStepByStepHandler sends the data though a channel and stops the parser thread behind every row. By calling the next() method, the data will be taken out of the channel, so that the parser thread can continue his work and so on.

Note: If the user has specified an XPath expression for the metadata, the document must contain the metadata, otherwise an exception will be thrown. If a document doesn't contain metadata, the user has to use the constructor method without the metadata. In this case, the XMLMetaDataCursor creates "default" Metadata (class DefaultMetadata). When the XMLMetaDataCursor tries to create this metadata, it is necessary, that the number of columns is known. Therefore, it's necessary, to read the first row, before the default metadata can be generated.

Constructor Detail

XMLMetaDataCursor

public XMLMetaDataCursor(Function inputStreamFactory,
                         String xPathtoData,
                         String[] SQLTypes,
                         Map idMap,
                         Function createTuple)
Creats an XMLMetaDataCursor with default metadata.

Parameters:
inputStreamFactory - A function that returns the document.
xPathtoData - This XPath expression describes the location of the data
SQLTypes - A string[] containing the sqltype-names which are used in the document
idMap - A user specified identifier map to configure the XML processing. See the description in the Sax class for details.
createTuple - Function that maps an Object array (column values) and a rmd object to a new result Tuple. xxl.relational.ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used.

Method Detail

hasNextObject

public boolean hasNextObject()
Moves the cursor down one row from its current position and computes the next tuple. A cursor is initially positioned before the first row. The first call to next makes the first row the current row. The second call makes the second row the current row, and so on.

Implementation: Takes data from the "communication" dataChannel, this causes the parser thread to continue.

Specified by:
hasNextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
true iff there is another object in the iteration.

Returns the next Object of the Iteration.

Returns:
the next Object of the Iteration.

Specified by:

supportsReset

public boolean supportsReset()
Description copied from class: AbstractCursor
Returns true if the reset operation is supported by the cursor. Otherwise it returns false.

The current implementation of this method is as follows: 

   public boolean supportsReset() {
       return false;
   }

Specified by:
supportsReset in interface Cursor
Overrides:
supportsReset in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
true if the reset operation is supported by the cursor, otherwise false.
